content.raw: @_jrivero_, I found some small bugs in GuiIface_TEST that may have caused it to fail on Jenkins. In particular, if I ran the tests in random order, noINIFile would often fail because the INI property it expected to be at a default value was being set by a previous test. Ahh, good point. I forgot about the auto-create functionality. We should keep the auto-create functionality for the HOME case, but not for the GUI_INI_PATH case. You can do something like this (note try to avoid using backslash to have text span multiple lines):

if (guiINIPath)
{
  path = guiINIPath;
  if (!boost::filesystem::exists(path))
  {
    gzerr << "GAZEBO_GUI_INI_PATH of [" << path << "] does not exist. No gui.ini will be loaded.\n";
    result = false;
    path.clear();
  }
}
else if (home)
{
    // Check the home directory
    // Construct the path to gui.ini
    path = home;
    path = path / ".gazebo" / "gui.ini";
}
else
{
    result = false;
    gzerr << "Neither HOME nor GAZEBO_GUI_INI_PATH environment variables were"
             << "found. Unable to locate gui.ini." << std::endl;
}

if (result && !path.empty())
{
